bug.author: wawltor
bug.summary: import paddle.fluid & import onnxruntime will be core_dump
bug.description: We have a problem, we want to use paddle, and when import onnxruntime and paddle.fluid, it will be core_dump directly, how to work out this problem?

comments.comment: Please let us know what is paddle.fluid and how to install it. Thanks.

I guess adding "-Bsymbolic" to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/cmake/onnxruntime.cmake>https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/cmake/onnxruntime.cmake</denchmark-link> could solve your problem.

I guess adding "-Bsymbolic" to https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/cmake/onnxruntime.cmake could solve your problem.
OKï¼Œis there some versions have make with adding "-Bsymbolic" ?

That's interesting. I can reproduce the bug but I don't know why it crashed. If Paddle can hide their C++ symbols(like what onnxruntime and onnx does) then the problem will be most likely gone. It should related to <denchmark-link:https://github.com/pybind/pybind11/issues/1262>pybind/pybind11#1262</denchmark-link>
I'll downgrade our compiler version to match with Paddle. Let's see what would happen after that.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/faxu>@faxu</denchmark-link> , downgrade to C++11 may solve this.
